title: Test Mobile Lifecycle Details
description: Application lifecycle information recorded via an ExperienceEvent that is specific to the Mobile channel. Includes field definitions for automatically collected data by the AEP Edge mobile extension library.

environment.title: Environment
environment.description: Information about the surrounding situation the event observation occurred in, specifically detailing transitory information such as the network or software versions.

device.title: Device
device.description: An identified device, application or device browser instance that is trackable across sessions, normally by cookies.

placeContext.title: Place context
placeContext.description: The transient circumstances related to the observation. Examples include locale specific information such as weather, local time, traffic, day of the week, workday vs. holiday, and working hours.

closeType.description: The type of the close event. A value of 'close' indicates the application signaled the close event. A value of 'unknown' indicates the application was launched without previously signaling it closed.

installDate.title: Install Date
installDate.description: Date of first launch after installation. Format: full-date without time (according to RFC 3339, section 5.6)

isClose.title: Is Close
isClose.description: Indicates whether or not this is an application close event.

isInstall.title: Is Install
isInstall.description: Indicates whether or not this is an application install event.

isLaunch.title: Is Launch
isLaunch.description: Indicates whether or not this is an application launch event.

isUpgrade.title: Is Upgrade
isUpgrade.description: Indicates whether or not this is an application upgrade event.

sessionLength.title: Session Length
sessionLength.description: Reports the number of seconds that a previous application session lasted based on how long the application was open and in the foreground. Session length is a positive value with no max bound (no max session length)

userPerspective.description: The perspective/physical relationship between the user and the app/brand at the time the event happened.  The most common are the app being in the foreground with the user directly interacting with it vs the app being in the background and still generating events.  Detached means the event was related to the app but didn't come directly from the app like the sending of an email or push notification from an external system.  Understanding the perspective of the user in relation to the app helps with accuratly generating sessions as the majority of the time you will not want to include background and detached events as part of an active session.
